summary: You know in the clip where Lucas goes in for a kiss and like Eliott doesn’t see because he looks away??  That just looked so...
question: You know in the clip where Lucas goes in for a kiss and like Eliott doesn’t see because he looks away??  That just looked so natural I feel like it has to be just improvised? Like axel was just playing off of the energy in the clip? It was adorable and also the thing the gang did at the end! It shows how well they work off of each other and how they immerse themselves in their characters
answer:
I feel like it possibly could have been improvised as well. It didn’t look scripted hahaha 😆 (same thing happened in the scene of Eliott waiting for Lucas outside of his class btw)

Who knows though 🤷🏼‍♀️ I agree they all kind of bounce off each other’s energy and acting choices really well. I really liked the clip too ♡

blog.name: skamamoroma
blog.description:
Meg. 20s. London.

Here for the Skam Cinematic Parallel Universes! But mainly Marti’s grandad shirts and Giovanni GaraU 💙

summary: If you had to choose a topic for any Skam to focus on that hasn’t been touched yet then what would you choose?
question: If you had to choose a topic for any Skam to focus on that hasn’t been touched yet then what would you choose?
answer:
Oh this is an interesting one! Anon, you made me think!

My very first choice would be Asexuality. 100%.

Another would be shyness. Not all young people are partiers, drinkers etc. That would be something many many young people could relate to.

I also really wanted Vilde’s season in the original. So so much. Her solo clip broke me and made me terribly sad we didn’t get to see her season, honestly. She was a very layered character and her story of a parent who was an addict (it was heavily suggested her mum had alcohol issues etc if I remember rightly, it’s been a while, and also perhaps mental health issues) where she had to step up and be a parent was shattering for me to watch and I’m sad we didn’t get to see that. I’m not sure if they gave Daphné a season, if we’d have the same issues there… it’d be interesting if they had the chance to go there and as it doesn’t seem like they intend to do the same with Silvia (and she’s a VERY different character to Vilde).

And because I won’t shut up about it… I’d love if they gave that kind of storyline to Gio. That pressure to be everything, to care for a sibling, to be the adult, to juggle and struggle and then realise you can rely on others for help and ask for help and be vulnerable.

It’ll never happen but I won’t shut up about it haha

summary: I read that Axel was inscure about his looks compared to maxecne and im like?? Bitch you are the cutest most adorable boy to...
question: I read that Axel was inscure about his looks compared to maxecne and im like?? Bitch you are the cutest most adorable boy to ever exist??? How dare you feel inscure???
answer:
I don’t know, my dude but I’ve been pretty much swooning over that dramatic bitch since the smoking scene in the party episode at the beginning of the season so 🤷🏼‍♀️

We all have our insecurities, that just goes to tell you how our perception of ourselves isn’t always the most reliable.

blog.name: shame-in-french
blog.title: All things Skam France
blog.description: Gifs from the French adaptation of SKAM. 🇫🇷 #shameinfrench

summary: am i the only one who feels like theres a more pronounced gap in maturity bw lucas and elliot than isak and even like lucas...
question: am i the only one who feels like theres a more pronounced gap in maturity bw lucas and elliot than isak and even like lucas really seems like ur typical young and stupid kid in high school whereas elliot comes off as a young adult in college whos got his shit together idk no hate i love elu but 2 years (how old r they?) can make all the difference when ur young and it shows sometimes in their interactions. I honestly cant see elliot mixing with the boy squad. Thoughts? (love this blog btw ❤)
answer: I don’t really see this. I actually think Eliott comes off younger than he is, he has this endearing energy. His drawings of him and Lucas as the raccoon and hedgehog is a little childish but adorable. Since they got together Lucas has got to be himself a bit more, he’s been cheeky but I’d say before that he’s not really had the chance to show his maturity level. He’d been too busy focusing on his secret to act normal.
